title: Video: MONEY – Goodnight London / The Sound Of The Death Of Everything (La Blogotheque)
content:
This was a collaboration just waiting to happen; Manchester pioneer’s MONEY hooking up with French website La Blogotheque. Their ‘takeaway’ shows set in niche setting are now a staple part of independent music, and are a sure sign of when a band is on the edge of greatness, certainly the case with MONEY. Filmed during this years The Great Escape festival in Brighton, and including a rendition of the stunning Goodnight London, played out on a well-worn piano in a quirky pub surrounded by locals swigging real ale, it’s the ideal setting for MONEY’s all-too-real imagery and emotional desolation.

Opening with a vocal only rendition of Bob Dylan’s Mr. Tambourine Man, it’s an encapsulating seven minutes, drawing the listener in before overwhelming with the sheer beauteous nature of the track. As the final notes of Goodnight London ring out, the ever present squawk of seagulls can be heard overheard, followed by Jamie’s child-like laughter; perfectly echoing the innocence and fragility of their music. Check out the video below, as well as an original poem by Jamie, entitled The Sound Of The Death Of Everything.
